ICRS2GCC¶

Functions to perform the transformation from ICRS coordinates to Galactocentric coordinates using the star’s parallax

class icrs2gcc.Star(source_id)¶

The class defines the object as a star with a Gaia ID. When defining an object with this class, the ID is the class argument.

Parameters

source_id (str) – Gaia ID

bayes_distance()¶

Coming in next release: Function that returns the heliocentric distance using bayes

Returns

heliocentric distance in pc (parsec) units using bayes

Return type

distance (float)

cov_matrix()¶

Function that returns the covariance matrix using uncertainties and correlations coefficient from Gaia

Returns

matrix covariance

Return type

matrix covariance (numpy array)

distance()¶

Function that returns the heliocentric distance

Returns

heliocentric distance in pc (parsec) units

Return type

distance (float)

icrs_to_gcc()¶

Function that returns the star position and velocity in galactocentric coordinates

Returns

the first three elements are the position coordinates in pc units and the rest are the velocity coordinates in km/s units

Return type

galactocentric coordinates (float numpy array)

query_gaia_object()¶

Function that returns all gaia information for the object with id source_id

Returns

astrometric and photometric information for the object with id source_id

Return type

Gaia information (astropy table)

relative_error_parallax()¶

Function that returns all gaia information for the object with id source_id

Returns

astrometric and photometric information for the object with id source_id

Return type

Gaia information (astropy table)
